page.title: 17Mushroom Farm
page.content: The Mushroom Farm is situated at G.R. 0347704103. Bob Clayton's family has run the farm for 45 years. He employs 17 people. They grow two types of mushroom- Agaricus Bistorsus and Agaricus Bisporus. The mushrooms are grown indoors on a{cropping area of 85,000 sq. ft.}This is because they are vertically stacked in pallets. The temperatures must be controlled to make sure the mushrooms can be continually grown all year round. The{temperatures} -they must be grown at different stages and range from 62 degrees F. to 140 degrees F. If they are grown at these temperatures they take 10 weeks to grow {Raw materials}are horse and chicken manure,fertiliser and peat moss. Exhausted materials are sold to parks. Prices 250p\3lb.punnet.{Markets}=w\sale markets in Liverpool,Wigan,etc.,Jersey and Guernsey.
